headline.main: Losing Count Of Calories As Plates Fill Up

docs.abstract: Marian Burros on difficulty of calculating calorie intake when restaurant portions continue to grow and there is no way of knowing what those portions contain; describes recent experiment in which four health professionals were unable to determine fat and calories in nine restaurant dishes, from club sandwiches to lasagna; photos (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: TRYING to estimate how many calories you eat in a day is risky business. You already know this if you have ever taken the time to compare your guesses with the numbers in a calorie guide. You are not alone. Even the experts have trouble. Consider a recent experiment.
